results.title: The Blinds and the Shutters
results.brief_description: This work presents a virtual world comprised of a modernist fictional house in a remote forest setting, whose contents gradually spill and float out of every aperture. Shoes and dresses, pots and pans, cutlery, pillows, blankets and plates journey in two directions simultaneously, some disappearing into the distance never to return, others appearing across all four screens in the installation. The larger objects fade up like apparitions, disappear and then reappear in strange locations, breaking all logic that is guiding this imaginary world. The slow drift of these household objects around the four screens is uncanny. While their journey suggests that the natural phenomenon of air is present, there is also a sense of airlessness; a claustrophobic, almost heavily scented environment. Despite sharing an energy force within the virtual environment, these objects are estranged – for they have lost their domestic relationship with one another. The sounds of bumps, collisions and muffled shuffles emerging from the interior of the house underscores the mystery of this scene. The disturbing atmosphere is most bizarre when the household goods are propelled into outer space, taking on the form of miniature satellites presumably tracking our behaviour from afar.

results.title: Fishtank
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
A high-rise flat in the U.K. Midlands. Ray is the father who drinks, Liz the mother, Jason the brother. There are some animals and the brother kills flies. The older brother films them with his handycam - intently observing whatever is going on.

In 1996 Richard Billingham’s ‘Ray’s a Laugh’ was hailed as the photo book of the decade. His photographs were one of the talking points of ‘Sensation’. Billingham has now made ‘Fishtank’, a commission for television by Artangel in collaboration with film-maker Adam Curtis and Illuminations TV for BBC2’s acclaimed TV series. The ‘video verite’ of Fishtank is contained within the compressed space/fishtank of the flat. Sometimes they talk, sometimes they argue. Billingham’s film registers the emotional temperature of this space and the family who live there with a closeness that transcends camera conventions. Like the paintings of Lucian Freud, Billingham crafts a terrible beauty from the landscape of family life and its patterns of pathos, despair and hope.

results.title: Et cetera. Episode 3 [1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival]
results.creator_credit: Northern Access TV, Michael Costello and David McLauchlan
results.brief_description:
Documents the 1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival Parade and the Fringe Furniture Exhibition, including interviews with Virginia Hyam, Fringe Director, and Axel, Fringe Furniture Co-ordinator. The Melbourne Fringe Festival has become an institution since its inception in 1982 when a small group of independent artists gathered together to create a platform to present new and independent art to the community. From those early beginnings the Melbourne-based festival now attracts interstate and international guests and covers a wide variety of arts
performances including outdoor events such as the Annual Parade in Brunswick Street, Fitzroy, the Annual Waiter’s Race, street-theatre and live bands and indoor events including comedy and cabaret, music and theatre. The Fringe Furniture Exhibition allows for young students
and designers an opportunity to show-off their creative ability and caters for non-mainstream pieces. Crazy, outrageous, quirky and even occasionally practical, the Exhibition contains an amazing selection of eclectic pieces as witnessed in this documentary program.
Reporters: Melissa Iaria and Phillip Taylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Northern Access TV, Michael Costello and David McLauchlan

results.title: Jaara Nyilamum
results.creator_credit: Lou Bennett AM and Romaine Moreton
results.credit_line:
Romaine Moreton (Goenpul Yagerabul Minjungbal Bundjalung) and Lou Bennett AM (Dja Dja Warrung, Yorta Yorta)
Single-channel video, 7:39 mins.
Filmed and edited by Romaine Moreton
Co-directed by Romaine Moreton and Lou Bennett AM
ACMI Collection

Jaara Nyilamum (song composition) Performed by Dr Lou Bennett AM and the Australian String Quartet
Composed by Dr Lou Bennett AM
Arranged by Iain Grandage
Produced by Stephen Snelleman
results.brief_description:
2021, Romaine Moreton (Goenpul Yagerabul Minjungbal Bundjalung), Lou Bennett AM (Dja Dja Warrung, Yorta Yorta)
Filmed & Edited by Romaine Moreton, Co-Directed by Romaine Moreton & Lou Bennett AM
H264 projection,16:9, colour, 7:39 mins
Jaara Nyilamum (song composition) Performed by Dr Lou Bennett AM and the Australian String Quartet, Composed by Dr Lou Bennett AM, Arranged by Iain Grandage, Produced by Stephen Snelleman

Dr Lou Bennett is a Performer, Songwriter, Musical and Artistic Director, Composer, Actor, Soundscape Designer and Academic. Lou’s research project ‘Sovereign Language Rematriation Through Song Pedagogy’ focusses on the importance and relevance of Indigenous language retrieval, reclamation, and regeneration through the medium of the Arts to enhance community health and wellbeing. Dr Romaine Moreton is an artist, writer, performer, filmmaker, and her proposes an Indigenous philosophy of story-telling and embodied knowledge, with her work constantly drawing our attention back to the importance of the breath in Indigenous cultural practices.

The making of Jaara Nyilamum (2021) evoked a stillness that restored us to full sensual immersion within country, and from this place of rooted calmness, country reaffirmed our Law is real. Jaara Nyilamum became most profound when we realised this was more than a film about ceremony, but was in fact, ceremony itself. Our challenge was to create a production model that aligned with our beliefs and centralised our Law, pushed back against monochronic time and engaged with the deep cycles of place, where we embraced Belonging as a process of constant renewal and Rematration.

results.title: Hades

constellations_other.name: Iconic creative partnerships
constellations_other.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult and writer-director Tony Mcnamara worked on The Favourite together before Hoult was cast in The Great. Strong creative partnerships between particular actors and directors are the backbone of screen creativity.

results.description: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.
description_for_label: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.

results.title: Another day
results.creator_credit: Zanthus Films, Jennie Blackwood and Anti Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Views of a number of people who have suffered from cancer leading normal happy lives. Stresses the importance of seeking medical advice and aid at the first suspicion that one has contracted the disease.

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Goldie
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: Lilly and the yellow cake
results.brief_description: Celebration of a cake recipe that has survived generations, ocean voyages, technological change and creative re-interpretation to unite a family.
